topics.body:
Wow; this is really weird.  I've been studying super hard to complete my C++ programming work in time and here's what is weird: I've been up for three days straight and I don't feel tired.

What I've been doing is that whenever my brain was telling me "go the fuck to sleep!" I just took a long hot shower to get my blood circulating more, basically the reason why ideas come to you in the tub is that the hot water increases circulation and helps improve oxygen flow, and I've sat down for a couple minutes here and there whenever I felt as though I was getting antsy and I just don't feel tired.  Since Friday night I've only slept four hours total.

This is weird.  I know there's a rare mutation to help 1% of people function with less sleep but this is kind of pushing it.
"@Carcass Strife":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/547cdfd26368725cbc2c0000#post_547cdfd26368725cbc2c0000
[bq="Carcass Strife"]"@EHAN":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/547cdf25636872428a1c0000#post_547cdf25636872428a1c0000
[bq="EHAN"]Even though Halo: Reach is probably one of my top 10 favorite games of all time[/bq]
I play that game too. Lllllllove it![/bq]
S.T.A.L.K.E.R. master race for life.
